    44‚Üí## **Part 1: RAG Evaluation Framework Design (30 minutes)**
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí### **Multi-Dimensional RAG Evaluation**
    47‚Üí
    48‚ÜíRAG systems require evaluation across multiple interconnected dimensions:
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí```python
    51‚Üí# Comprehensive RAG evaluation framework
    52‚Üífrom typing import List, Dict, Any, Optional, Tuple
    53‚Üíimport numpy as np
    54‚Üífrom dataclasses import dataclass
    55‚Üífrom abc import ABC, abstractmethod
    56‚Üíimport json
    57‚Üíimport time
    58‚Üífrom collections import defaultdict
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí@dataclass
    61‚Üíclass RAGEvaluationResult:
    62‚Üí    """Structured result for RAG evaluation."""
    63‚Üí    query: str
    64‚Üí    retrieved_contexts: List[str]
    65‚Üí    generated_answer: str
    66‚Üí    reference_answer: Optional[str] = None
    67‚Üí    retrieval_scores: Dict[str, float] = None
    68‚Üí    generation_scores: Dict[str, float] = None
    69‚Üí    end_to_end_scores: Dict[str, float] = None
    70‚Üí    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = None
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üíclass RAGEvaluationFramework:
    73‚Üí    """Comprehensive evaluation framework for RAG systems."""
    74‚Üí    
    75‚Üí    def __init__(self, llm_judge, embedding_model):
    76‚Üí        self.llm_judge = llm_judge
    77‚Üí        self.embedding_model = embedding_model
    78‚Üí        
    79‚Üí        # Initialize evaluators for different dimensions
    80‚Üí        self.evaluators = {
    81‚Üí            'retrieval': RetrievalEvaluator(embedding_model),
    82‚Üí            'generation': GenerationEvaluator(llm_judge),
    83‚Üí            'end_to_end': EndToEndEvaluator(llm_judge),
    84‚Üí            'factual': FactualConsistencyEvaluator(llm_judge),
    85‚Üí            'relevance': RelevanceEvaluator(llm_judge)
    86‚Üí        }
    87‚Üí        
    88‚Üí        # Evaluation metrics registry
    89‚Üí        self.metrics_registry = {
    90‚Üí            'precision_at_k': self._precision_at_k,
    91‚Üí            'recall_at_k': self._recall_at_k,
    92‚Üí            'mrr': self._mean_reciprocal_rank,
    93‚Üí            'ndcg': self._normalized_dcg,
    94‚Üí            'semantic_similarity': self._semantic_similarity,
    95‚Üí            'answer_relevance': self._answer_relevance,
    96‚Üí            'faithfulness': self._faithfulness,
    97‚Üí            'context_precision': self._context_precision,
    98‚Üí            'context_recall': self._context_recall
    99‚Üí        }
   100‚Üí    
   101‚Üí    def evaluate_rag_system(self, test_dataset: List[Dict],
   102‚Üí                           rag_system,
   103‚Üí                           evaluation_config: Dict) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   104‚Üí        """Comprehensive evaluation of RAG system."""
   105‚Üí        
   106‚Üí        print(f"Evaluating RAG system on {len(test_dataset)} examples...")
   107‚Üí        
   108‚Üí        evaluation_results = []
   109‚Üí        performance_metrics = defaultdict(list)
   110‚Üí        
   111‚Üí        for i, test_case in enumerate(test_dataset):
   112‚Üí            if i % 10 == 0:
   113‚Üí                print(f"Evaluating example {i+1}/{len(test_dataset)}")
   114‚Üí            
   115‚Üí            # Run RAG system
   116‚Üí            rag_result = self._run_rag_system(rag_system, test_case)
   117‚Üí            
   118‚Üí            # Evaluate across all dimensions
   119‚Üí            eval_result = self._evaluate_single_case(
   120‚Üí                test_case, rag_result, evaluation_config
   121‚Üí            )
   122‚Üí            
   123‚Üí            evaluation_results.append(eval_result)
   124‚Üí            
   125‚Üí            # Aggregate metrics
   126‚Üí            self._aggregate_metrics(eval_result, performance_metrics)
   127‚Üí        
   128‚Üí        # Compute final metrics
   129‚Üí        final_metrics = self._compute_final_metrics(performance_metrics)
   130‚Üí        
   131‚Üí        return {
   132‚Üí            'individual_results': evaluation_results,
   133‚Üí            'aggregate_metrics': final_metrics,
   134‚Üí            'evaluation_config': evaluation_config,
   135‚Üí            'dataset_size': len(test_dataset),
   136‚Üí            'evaluation_timestamp': time.time()
   137‚Üí        }
   138‚Üí```
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üí### **RAGAS Integration**
   141‚Üí
   142‚ÜíRAGAS (RAG Assessment) provides standardized evaluation metrics:
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí```python
   145‚Üí# RAGAS integration for standardized evaluation
   146‚Üífrom ragas import evaluate
   147‚Üífrom ragas.metrics import (
   148‚Üí    faithfulness,
   149‚Üí    answer_relevancy,
   150‚Üí    context_precision,
   151‚Üí    context_recall,
   152‚Üí    context_relevancy,
   153‚Üí    answer_correctness,
   154‚Üí    answer_similarity
   155‚Üí)
   156‚Üífrom datasets import Dataset
   157‚Üí
   158‚Üíclass RAGASEvaluator:
   159‚Üí    """RAGAS-based evaluation system."""
   160‚Üí    
   161‚Üí    def __init__(self, llm_model, embedding_model):
   162‚Üí        self.llm_model = llm_model
   163‚Üí        self.embedding_model = embedding_model
   164‚Üí        
   165‚Üí        # Configure RAGAS metrics
   166‚Üí        self.metrics = [
   167‚Üí            faithfulness,           # Factual consistency
   168‚Üí            answer_relevancy,       # Answer relevance to question
   169‚Üí            context_precision,      # Precision of retrieved context
   170‚Üí            context_recall,         # Recall of retrieved context
   171‚Üí            context_relevancy,      # Relevance of context to question
   172‚Üí            answer_correctness,     # Correctness compared to ground truth
   173‚Üí            answer_similarity       # Semantic similarity to ground truth
   174‚Üí        ]
   175‚Üí        
   176‚Üí        # Initialize with models
   177‚Üí        for metric in self.metrics:
   178‚Üí            if hasattr(metric, 'init'):
   179‚Üí                metric.init(self.llm_model, self.embedding_model)
   180‚Üí    
   181‚Üí    def evaluate_with_ragas(self, rag_results: List[Dict],
   182‚Üí                           include_ground_truth: bool = True) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   183‚Üí        """Evaluate using RAGAS framework."""
   184‚Üí        
   185‚Üí        # Prepare dataset in RAGAS format
   186‚Üí        dataset_dict = self._prepare_ragas_dataset(rag_results, include_ground_truth)
   187‚Üí        dataset = Dataset.from_dict(dataset_dict)
   188‚Üí        
   189‚Üí        # Select metrics based on available data
   190‚Üí        selected_metrics = self._select_metrics(include_ground_truth)
   191‚Üí        
   192‚Üí        print(f"Running RAGAS evaluation with {len(selected_metrics)} metrics...")
   193‚Üí        
   194‚Üí        # Run evaluation
   195‚Üí        ragas_results = evaluate(
   196‚Üí            dataset=dataset,
   197‚Üí            metrics=selected_metrics
   198‚Üí        )
   199‚Üí        
   200‚Üí        return {
   201‚Üí            'ragas_scores': ragas_results,
   202‚Üí            'metric_descriptions': self._get_metric_descriptions(),
   203‚Üí            'dataset_size': len(rag_results),
   204‚Üí            'evaluation_summary': self._summarize_ragas_results(ragas_results)
   205‚Üí        }
   206‚Üí```
   207‚Üí
   208‚Üí**Step 1: RAGAS Dataset Preparation**
   209‚Üí```python
   210‚Üí    def _prepare_ragas_dataset(self, rag_results: List[Dict], 
   211‚Üí                              include_ground_truth: bool) -> Dict[str, List]:
   212‚Üí        """Prepare dataset in RAGAS format."""
   213‚Üí        
   214‚Üí        dataset_dict = {
   215‚Üí            'question': [],
   216‚Üí            'answer': [],
   217‚Üí            'contexts': [],
   218‚Üí            'ground_truths': [] if include_ground_truth else None
   219‚Üí        }
   220‚Üí        
   221‚Üí        for result in rag_results:
   222‚Üí            dataset_dict['question'].append(result['query'])
   223‚Üí            dataset_dict['answer'].append(result['generated_answer'])
   224‚Üí            
   225‚Üí            # Format contexts as list of strings
   226‚Üí            contexts = []
   227‚Üí            if 'retrieved_contexts' in result:
   228‚Üí                contexts = [
   229‚Üí                    ctx if isinstance(ctx, str) else ctx['content']
   230‚Üí                    for ctx in result['retrieved_contexts']
   231‚Üí                ]
   232‚Üí            dataset_dict['contexts'].append(contexts)
   233‚Üí            
   234‚Üí            # Add ground truth if available
   235‚Üí            if include_ground_truth and 'ground_truth' in result:
   236‚Üí                if dataset_dict['ground_truths'] is not None:
   237‚Üí                    # Ground truth should be a list
   238‚Üí                    gt = result['ground_truth']
   239‚Üí                    if isinstance(gt, str):
   240‚Üí                        gt = [gt]
   241‚Üí                    dataset_dict['ground_truths'].append(gt)
   242‚Üí        
   243‚Üí        # Remove ground_truths if not using
   244‚Üí        if not include_ground_truth:
   245‚Üí            del dataset_dict['ground_truths']
   246‚Üí        
   247‚Üí        return dataset_dict
   248‚Üí```

   250‚Üí### **Custom Evaluation Metrics**
   251‚Üí
   252‚ÜíImplement domain-specific and advanced evaluation metrics:
   253‚Üí
   254‚Üí```python
   255‚Üí# Custom evaluation metrics
   256‚Üíclass CustomRAGMetrics:
   257‚Üí    """Custom evaluation metrics for specialized RAG applications."""
   258‚Üí    
   259‚Üí    def __init__(self, llm_judge, domain_knowledge: Optional[Dict] = None):
   260‚Üí        self.llm_judge = llm_judge
   261‚Üí        self.domain_knowledge = domain_knowledge or {}
   262‚Üí        
   263‚Üí    def evaluate_answer_completeness(self, query: str, answer: str, 
   264‚Üí                                   contexts: List[str]) -> float:
   265‚Üí        """Evaluate how completely the answer addresses the query."""
   266‚Üí        
   267‚Üí        completeness_prompt = f"""
   268‚Üí        Evaluate how completely this answer addresses the given question based on the provided contexts.
   269‚Üí        
   270‚Üí        Question: {query}
   271‚Üí        
   272‚Üí        Answer: {answer}
   273‚Üí        
   274‚Üí        Available Contexts: {' '.join(contexts[:3])}
   275‚Üí        
   276‚Üí        Rate completeness on a scale of 0.0 to 1.0:
   277‚Üí        - 1.0: Answer fully and comprehensively addresses all aspects of the question
   278‚Üí        - 0.7: Answer addresses most important aspects but misses some details
   279‚Üí        - 0.4: Answer partially addresses the question but lacks important information
   280‚Üí        - 0.1: Answer barely addresses the question or contains mostly irrelevant information
   281‚Üí        - 0.0: Answer completely fails to address the question
   282‚Üí        
   283‚Üí        Consider:
   284‚Üí        1. Does the answer cover all aspects of the question?
   285‚Üí        2. Are important details included?
   286‚Üí        3. Is the scope of the answer appropriate?
   287‚Üí        4. Does the answer use information from the contexts effectively?
   288‚Üí        
   289‚Üí        Return only a number between 0.0 and 1.0:
   290‚Üí        """
   291‚Üí        
   292‚Üí        try:
   293‚Üí            response = self.llm_judge.predict(completeness_prompt).strip()
   294‚Üí            score = float(response)
   295‚Üí            return max(0.0, min(1.0, score))
   296‚Üí        except:
   297‚Üí            return 0.5
   298‚Üí    
   299‚Üí    def evaluate_citation_quality(self, answer: str, contexts: List[str]) -> float:
   300‚Üí        """Evaluate <USER_ID_REDACTED> of citations and source attribution."""
   301‚Üí        
   302‚Üí        # Count citations in answer
   303‚Üí        citation_patterns = ['[Source:', '(Source:', 'According to', 'As stated in']
   304‚Üí        citation_count = sum(
   305‚Üí            answer.lower().count(pattern.lower()) for pattern in citation_patterns
   306‚Üí        )
   307‚Üí        
   308‚Üí        # Check if citations match available contexts
   309‚Üí        valid_citations = 0
   310‚Üí        for context in contexts:
   311‚Üí            # Simple check if context information appears in answer
   312‚Üí            context_words = set(context.lower().split())
   313‚Üí            answer_words = set(answer.lower().split())
   314‚Üí            overlap = len(context_words.intersection(answer_words))
   315‚Üí            
   316‚Üí            if overlap > 5:  # Threshold for meaningful overlap
   317‚Üí                valid_citations += 1
   318‚Üí        
   319‚Üí        # Calculate citation <USER_ID_REDACTED> score
   320‚Üí        if len(contexts) == 0:
   321‚Üí            return 0.0
   322‚Üí        
   323‚Üí        citation_coverage = valid_citations / len(contexts)
   324‚Üí        citation_frequency = min(citation_count / 3, 1.0)  # Normalize to max 1
   325‚Üí        
   326‚Üí        # Weighted average
   327‚Üí        citation_quality = 0.7 * citation_coverage + 0.3 * citation_frequency
   328‚Üí        
   329‚Üí        return citation_quality
   330‚Üí```

   332‚Üí**Step 2: Retrieval <USER_ID_REDACTED> Assessment**
   333‚Üí```python
   334‚Üíclass RetrievalEvaluator:
   335‚Üí    """Specialized evaluator for retrieval <USER_ID_REDACTED>."""
   336‚Üí    
   337‚Üí    def __init__(self, embedding_model):
   338‚Üí        self.embedding_model = embedding_model
   339‚Üí        
   340‚Üí    def evaluate_retrieval_quality(self, query: str, retrieved_contexts: List[str],
   341‚Üí                                 ground_truth_contexts: List[str] = None) -> Dict[str, float]:
   342‚Üí        """Comprehensive retrieval <USER_ID_REDACTED> evaluation."""
   343‚Üí        
   344‚Üí        metrics = {}
   345‚Üí        
   346‚Üí        # Semantic relevance of retrieved contexts
   347‚Üí        metrics['semantic_relevance'] = self._calculate_semantic_relevance(
   348‚Üí            query, retrieved_contexts
   349‚Üí        )
   350‚Üí        
   351‚Üí        # Diversity of retrieved contexts
   352‚Üí        metrics['context_diversity'] = self._calculate_context_diversity(
   353‚Üí            retrieved_contexts
   354‚Üí        )
   355‚Üí        
   356‚Üí        # Coverage of information needs
   357‚Üí        metrics['information_coverage'] = self._assess_information_coverage(
   358‚Üí            query, retrieved_contexts
   359‚Üí        )
   360‚Üí        
   361‚Üí        # If ground truth available, calculate precision/recall
   362‚Üí        if ground_truth_contexts:
   363‚Üí            precision_recall = self._calculate_precision_recall(
   364‚Üí                retrieved_contexts, ground_truth_contexts
   365‚Üí            )
   366‚Üí            metrics.update(precision_recall)
   367‚Üí        
   368‚Üí        return metrics
   369‚Üí    
   370‚Üí    def _calculate_semantic_relevance(self, query: str, 
   371‚Üí                                    contexts: List[str]) -> float:
   372‚Üí        """Calculate average semantic relevance of contexts to query."""
   373‚Üí        
   374‚Üí        if not contexts:
   375‚Üí            return 0.0
   376‚Üí        
   377‚Üí        query_embedding = self.embedding_model.encode([query])[0]
   378‚Üí        context_embeddings = self.embedding_model.encode(contexts)
   379‚Üí        
   380‚Üí        # Calculate similarities
   381‚Üí        similarities = []
   382‚Üí        for ctx_emb in context_embeddings:
   383‚Üí            similarity = np.dot(query_embedding, ctx_emb) / (
   384‚Üí                np.linalg.norm(query_embedding) * np.linalg.norm(ctx_emb)
   385‚Üí            )
   386‚Üí            similarities.append(similarity)
   387‚Üí        
   388‚Üí        return float(np.mean(similarities))
   389‚Üí    
   390‚Üí    def _calculate_context_diversity(self, contexts: List[str]) -> float:
   391‚Üí        """Calculate diversity among retrieved contexts."""
   392‚Üí        
   393‚Üí        if len(contexts) < 2:
   394‚Üí            return 1.0  # Single context is maximally diverse
   395‚Üí        
   396‚Üí        context_embeddings = self.embedding_model.encode(contexts)
   397‚Üí        
   398‚Üí        # Calculate pairwise similarities
   399‚Üí        similarities = []
   400‚Üí        for i in range(len(context_embeddings)):
   401‚Üí            for j in range(i+1, len(context_embeddings)):
   402‚Üí                similarity = np.dot(context_embeddings[i], context_embeddings[j]) / (
   403‚Üí                    np.linalg.norm(context_embeddings[i]) * np.linalg.norm(context_embeddings[j])
   404‚Üí                )
   405‚Üí                similarities.append(similarity)
   406‚Üí        
   407‚Üí        # Diversity is inverse of average similarity
   408‚Üí        avg_similarity = np.mean(similarities)
   409‚Üí        diversity = 1.0 - avg_similarity
   410‚Üí        
   411‚Üí        return max(0.0, diversity)
   412‚Üí```

   423‚Üí# LLM-as-a-Judge evaluation system

   443‚Üí        """Evaluate response <USER_ID_REDACTED> using LLM judge."""

   447‚Üí

   456‚Üí                evaluation_results[aspect] = score
   457‚Üí                detailed_feedback[aspect] = feedback
   458‚Üí        
   459‚Üí        # Calculate overall score

   461‚Üí

   464‚Üí            'overall_score': overall_score,
   465‚Üí            'detailed_feedback': detailed_feedback,
   466‚Üí            'evaluation_summary': self._generate_evaluation_summary(
   467‚Üí                evaluation_results, detailed_feedback

   543‚Üí### **Automated Benchmark Testing**
   544‚Üí
   545‚ÜíCreate automated pipelines for continuous evaluation:
   546‚Üí
   547‚Üí```python
   548‚Üí# Automated benchmark testing system
   549‚Üíclass AutomatedRAGBenchmark:
   550‚Üí    """Automated benchmark testing for RAG systems."""
   551‚Üí    
   552‚Üí    def __init__(self, evaluation_framework, test_datasets: Dict[str, List]):
   553‚Üí        self.evaluation_framework = evaluation_framework
   554‚Üí        self.test_datasets = test_datasets
   555‚Üí        self.benchmark_history = []
   556‚Üí        
   557‚Üí    def run_comprehensive_benchmark(self, rag_system,
   558‚Üí                                   benchmark_config: Dict) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   559‚Üí        """Run comprehensive benchmark across multiple test datasets."""
   560‚Üí        
   561‚Üí        benchmark_results = {
   562‚Üí            'timestamp': time.time(),
   563‚Üí            'config': benchmark_config,
   564‚Üí            'dataset_results': {},
   565‚Üí            'aggregate_performance': {}
   566‚Üí        }
   567‚Üí        
   568‚Üí        print("Starting comprehensive RAG benchmark...")
   569‚Üí        
   570‚Üí        # Run evaluation on each test dataset
   571‚Üí        for dataset_name, dataset in self.test_datasets.items():
   572‚Üí            print(f"\nEvaluating on {dataset_name} dataset ({len(dataset)} examples)")
   573‚Üí            
   574‚Üí            dataset_result = self.evaluation_framework.evaluate_rag_system(
   575‚Üí                dataset, rag_system, benchmark_config
   576‚Üí            )
   577‚Üí            
   578‚Üí            benchmark_results['dataset_results'][dataset_name] = dataset_result
   579‚Üí            
   580‚Üí            # Extract key metrics for aggregation
   581‚Üí            self._extract_key_metrics(dataset_name, dataset_result, benchmark_results)
   582‚Üí        
   583‚Üí        # Calculate cross-dataset aggregates
   584‚Üí        benchmark_results['aggregate_performance'] = self._calculate_aggregate_performance(
   585‚Üí            benchmark_results['dataset_results']
   586‚Üí        )
   587‚Üí        
   588‚Üí        # Store in benchmark history
   589‚Üí        self.benchmark_history.append(benchmark_results)
   590‚Üí        
   591‚Üí        # Generate performance report
   592‚Üí        performance_report = self._generate_performance_report(benchmark_results)
   593‚Üí        benchmark_results['performance_report'] = performance_report
   594‚Üí        
   595‚Üí        return benchmark_results
   596‚Üí```
   597‚Üí
   598‚Üí**Step 4: Performance Tracking and Regression Detection**
   599‚Üí```python
   600‚Üí    def detect_performance_regression(self, current_results: Dict,
   601‚Üí                                    threshold: float = 0.05) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   602‚Üí        """Detect performance regression compared to previous benchmarks."""
   603‚Üí        
   604‚Üí        if len(self.benchmark_history) < 2:
   605‚Üí            return {'regression_detected': False, 'message': 'Insufficient history for comparison'}
   606‚Üí        
   607‚Üí        previous_results = self.benchmark_history[-2]  # Previous benchmark
   608‚Üí        
   609‚Üí        regression_analysis = {
   610‚Üí            'regression_detected': False,
   611‚Üí            'declining_metrics': [],
   612‚Üí            'improving_metrics': [],
   613‚Üí            'stable_metrics': [],
   614‚Üí            'overall_change': 0.0
   615‚Üí        }
   616‚Üí        
   617‚Üí        # Compare key metrics across datasets
   618‚Üí        for dataset_name in current_results['dataset_results']:
   619‚Üí            if dataset_name in previous_results['dataset_results']:
   620‚Üí                current_metrics = current_results['dataset_results'][dataset_name]['aggregate_metrics']
   621‚Üí                previous_metrics = previous_results['dataset_results'][dataset_name]['aggregate_metrics']
   622‚Üí                
   623‚Üí                for metric_name in current_metrics:
   624‚Üí                    if metric_name in previous_metrics:
   625‚Üí                        current_score = current_metrics[metric_name]
   626‚Üí                        previous_score = previous_metrics[metric_name]
   627‚Üí                        change = current_score - previous_score
   628‚Üí                        
   629‚Üí                        if change < -threshold:  # Significant decline
   630‚Üí                            regression_analysis['declining_metrics'].append({
   631‚Üí                                'dataset': dataset_name,
   632‚Üí                                'metric': metric_name,
   633‚Üí                                'change': change,
   634‚Üí                                'current': current_score,
   635‚Üí                                'previous': previous_score
   636‚Üí                            })
   637‚Üí                            regression_analysis['regression_detected'] = True
   638‚Üí                        elif change > threshold:  # Significant improvement
   639‚Üí                            regression_analysis['improving_metrics'].append({
   640‚Üí                                'dataset': dataset_name,
   641‚Üí                                'metric': metric_name,
   642‚Üí                                'change': change,
   643‚Üí                                'current': current_score,
   644‚Üí                                'previous': previous_score
   645‚Üí                            })
   646‚Üí                        else:  # Stable performance
   647‚Üí                            regression_analysis['stable_metrics'].append({
   648‚Üí                                'dataset': dataset_name,
   649‚Üí                                'metric': metric_name,
   650‚Üí                                'change': change
   651‚Üí                            })
   652‚Üí        
   653‚Üí        # Calculate overall performance change
   654‚Üí        if regression_analysis['declining_metrics'] or regression_analysis['improving_metrics']:
   655‚Üí            all_changes = [m['change'] for m in regression_analysis['declining_metrics']] + \
   656‚Üí                         [m['change'] for m in regression_analysis['improving_metrics']]
   657‚Üí            regression_analysis['overall_change'] = np.mean(all_changes)
   658‚Üí        
   659‚Üí        return regression_analysis
   660‚Üí```

   664‚Üí## **Part 3: A/B Testing for RAG Optimization (20 minutes)**
   665‚Üí
   666‚Üí### **RAG Component A/B Testing**
   667‚Üí
   668‚ÜíTest different RAG components systematically:
   669‚Üí
   670‚Üí```python
   671‚Üí# A/B testing framework for RAG systems
   672‚Üíclass RAGABTestFramework:
   673‚Üí    """A/B testing framework for RAG system optimization."""
   674‚Üí    
   675‚Üí    def __init__(self, evaluation_framework):
   676‚Üí        self.evaluation_framework = evaluation_framework
   677‚Üí        self.active_tests = {}
   678‚Üí        self.test_history = []
   679‚Üí        
   680‚Üí    def setup_ab_test(self, test_name: str, 
   681‚Üí                     component_variants: Dict[str, Any],
   682‚Üí                     test_dataset: List[Dict],
   683‚Üí                     test_config: Dict) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   684‚Üí        """Setup A/B test for RAG component comparison."""
   685‚Üí        
   686‚Üí        test_setup = {
   687‚Üí            'test_name': test_name,
   688‚Üí            'variants': component_variants,
   689‚Üí            'dataset': test_dataset,
   690‚Üí            'config': test_config,
   691‚Üí            'start_time': time.time(),
   692‚Üí            'status': 'setup'
   693‚Üí        }
   694‚Üí        
   695‚Üí        # Validate test setup
   696‚Üí        validation_result = self._validate_test_setup(test_setup)
   697‚Üí        if not validation_result['valid']:
   698‚Üí            raise ValueError(f"Invalid test setup: {validation_result['errors']}")
   699‚Üí        
   700‚Üí        self.active_tests[test_name] = test_setup
   701‚Üí        
   702‚Üí        print(f"A/B test '{test_name}' setup complete with {len(component_variants)} variants")
   703‚Üí        return test_setup
   704‚Üí    
   705‚Üí    def run_ab_test(self, test_name: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   706‚Üí        """Execute A/B test and collect results."""
   707‚Üí        
   708‚Üí        if test_name not in self.active_tests:
   709‚Üí            raise ValueError(f"Test '{test_name}' not found in active tests")
   710‚Üí        
   711‚Üí        test_setup = self.active_tests[test_name]
   712‚Üí        test_setup['status'] = 'running'
   713‚Üí        
   714‚Üí        print(f"Running A/B test: {test_name}")
   715‚Üí        
   716‚Üí        variant_results = {}
   717‚Üí        
   718‚Üí        # Test each variant
   719‚Üí        for variant_name, variant_config in test_setup['variants'].items():
   720‚Üí            print(f"  Testing variant: {variant_name}")
   721‚Üí            
   722‚Üí            # Create RAG system with variant configuration
   723‚Üí            rag_system = self._create_rag_variant(variant_config)
   724‚Üí            
   725‚Üí            # Evaluate variant
   726‚Üí            variant_result = self.evaluation_framework.evaluate_rag_system(
   727‚Üí                test_setup['dataset'], 
   728‚Üí                rag_system, 
   729‚Üí                test_setup['config']
   730‚Üí            )
   731‚Üí            
   732‚Üí            variant_results[variant_name] = variant_result
   733‚Üí        
   734‚Üí        # Analyze results
   735‚Üí        analysis_result = self._analyze_ab_results(variant_results, test_setup)
   736‚Üí        
   737‚Üí        # Complete test
   738‚Üí        test_result = {
   739‚Üí            'test_name': test_name,
   740‚Üí            'test_setup': test_setup,
   741‚Üí            'variant_results': variant_results,
   742‚Üí            'analysis': analysis_result,
   743‚Üí            'completion_time': time.time(),
   744‚Üí            'duration': time.time() - test_setup['start_time']
   745‚Üí        }
   746‚Üí        
   747‚Üí        # Update test status
   748‚Üí        test_setup['status'] = 'completed'
   749‚Üí        self.test_history.append(test_result)
   750‚Üí        
   751‚Üí        return test_result
   752‚Üí```

   754‚Üí**Step 5: Statistical Significance Testing**
   755‚Üí```python
   756‚Üí    def _analyze_ab_results(self, variant_results: Dict, 
   757‚Üí                          test_setup: Dict) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   758‚Üí        """Analyze A/B test results with statistical significance testing."""
   759‚Üí        
   760‚Üí        from scipy import stats
   761‚Üí        
   762‚Üí        analysis = {
   763‚Üí            'winner': None,
   764‚Üí            'statistical_significance': {},
   765‚Üí            'effect_sizes': {},
   766‚Üí            'recommendations': [],
   767‚Üí            'detailed_comparison': {}
   768‚Üí        }
   769‚Üí        
   770‚Üí        # Extract key metrics for comparison
   771‚Üí        metric_comparisons = defaultdict(dict)
   772‚Üí        
   773‚Üí        for variant_name, result in variant_results.items():
   774‚Üí            for metric_name, metric_value in result['aggregate_metrics'].items():
   775‚Üí                metric_comparisons[metric_name][variant_name] = metric_value
   776‚Üí        
   777‚Üí        # Perform pairwise comparisons
   778‚Üí        variant_names = list(variant_results.keys())
   779‚Üí        
   780‚Üí        for metric_name, metric_data in metric_comparisons.items():
   781‚Üí            analysis['detailed_comparison'][metric_name] = {}
   782‚Üí            
   783‚Üí            for i, variant_a in enumerate(variant_names):
   784‚Üí                for variant_b in variant_names[i+1:]:
   785‚Üí                    
   786‚Üí                    score_a = metric_data[variant_a]
   787‚Üí                    score_b = metric_data[variant_b]
   788‚Üí                    
   789‚Üí                    # Calculate effect size (Cohen's d approximation)
   790‚Üí                    effect_size = abs(score_a - score_b) / max(
   791‚Üí                        np.std([score_a, score_b]), 0.01
   792‚Üí                    )
   793‚Üí                    
   794‚Üí                    # Simple significance test (would need individual scores for proper test)
   795‚Üí                    difference = abs(score_a - score_b)
   796‚Üí                    is_significant = difference > 0.05  # Simple threshold
   797‚Üí                    
   798‚Üí                    comparison_key = f"{variant_a}_vs_{variant_b}"
   799‚Üí                    analysis['detailed_comparison'][metric_name][comparison_key] = {
   800‚Üí                        'variant_a_score': score_a,
   801‚Üí                        'variant_b_score': score_b,
   802‚Üí                        'difference': score_a - score_b,
   803‚Üí                        'effect_size': effect_size,
   804‚Üí                        'is_significant': is_significant,
   805‚Üí                        'better_variant': variant_a if score_a > score_b else variant_b
   806‚Üí                    }
   807‚Üí        
   808‚Üí        # Determine overall winner
   809‚Üí        analysis['winner'] = self._determine_overall_winner(
   810‚Üí            variant_results, analysis['detailed_comparison']
   811‚Üí        )
   812‚Üí        
   813‚Üí        # Generate recommendations
   814‚Üí        analysis['recommendations'] = self._generate_test_recommendations(analysis)
   815‚Üí        
   816‚Üí        return analysis
   817‚Üí```

   819‚Üí### **Multi-Armed Bandit Testing**
   820‚Üí
   821‚ÜíImplement adaptive testing strategies:
   822‚Üí
   823‚Üí```python
   824‚Üí# Multi-armed bandit for RAG optimization
   825‚Üíclass RAGMultiArmedBandit:
   826‚Üí    """Multi-armed bandit for adaptive RAG system optimization."""
   827‚Üí    
   828‚Üí    def __init__(self, variants: List[str], exploration_rate: float = 0.1):
   829‚Üí        self.variants = variants
   830‚Üí        self.exploration_rate = exploration_rate
   831‚Üí        
   832‚Üí        # Initialize bandit arms
   833‚Üí        self.arm_counts = {variant: 0 for variant in variants}
   834‚Üí        self.arm_rewards = {variant: 0.0 for variant in variants}
   835‚Üí        self.arm_avg_rewards = {variant: 0.0 for variant in variants}
   836‚Üí        
   837‚Üí        self.total_trials = 0
   838‚Üí        self.trial_history = []
   839‚Üí    
   840‚Üí    def select_variant(self) -> str:
   841‚Üí        """Select variant using epsilon-greedy strategy."""
   842‚Üí        
   843‚Üí        # Exploration: random selection
   844‚Üí        if np.random.random() < self.exploration_rate:
   845‚Üí            selected_variant = np.random.choice(self.variants)
   846‚Üí            selection_reason = "exploration"
   847‚Üí        else:
   848‚Üí            # Exploitation: select best performing variant
   849‚Üí            if self.total_trials == 0:
   850‚Üí                selected_variant = np.random.choice(self.variants)
   851‚Üí                selection_reason = "random_initial"
   852‚Üí            else:
   853‚Üí                best_variant = max(self.arm_avg_rewards.items(), key=lambda x: x[1])[0]
   854‚Üí                selected_variant = best_variant
   855‚Üí                selection_reason = "exploitation"
   856‚Üí        
   857‚Üí        return selected_variant
   858‚Üí    
   859‚Üí    def update_reward(self, variant: str, reward: float):
   860‚Üí        """Update reward for selected variant."""
   861‚Üí        
   862‚Üí        self.arm_counts[variant] += 1
   863‚Üí        self.arm_rewards[variant] += reward
   864‚Üí        self.arm_avg_rewards[variant] = self.arm_rewards[variant] / self.arm_counts[variant]
   865‚Üí        
   866‚Üí        self.total_trials += 1
   867‚Üí        
   868‚Üí        # Record trial
   869‚Üí        self.trial_history.append({
   870‚Üí            'trial': self.total_trials,
   871‚Üí            'variant': variant,
   872‚Üí            'reward': reward,
   873‚Üí            'avg_reward': self.arm_avg_rewards[variant],
   874‚Üí            'timestamp': time.time()
   875‚Üí        })
   876‚Üí    
   877‚Üí    def get_performance_summary(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   878‚Üí        """Get current performance summary."""
   879‚Üí        
   880‚Üí        return {
   881‚Üí            'total_trials': self.total_trials,
   882‚Üí            'variant_performance': {
   883‚Üí                variant: {
   884‚Üí                    'trials': self.arm_counts[variant],
   885‚Üí                    'total_reward': self.arm_rewards[variant],
   886‚Üí                    'average_reward': self.arm_avg_rewards[variant],
   887‚Üí                    'selection_rate': self.arm_counts[variant] / max(self.total_trials, 1)
   888‚Üí                }
   889‚Üí                for variant in self.variants
   890‚Üí            },
   891‚Üí            'best_variant': max(self.arm_avg_rewards.items(), key=lambda x: x[1])[0] if self.total_trials > 0 else None,
   892‚Üí            'exploration_rate': self.exploration_rate
   893‚Üí        }
   894‚Üí```

   967‚Üí**Step 6: <USER_ID_REDACTED> Monitoring Implementation**
   968‚Üí```python
   969‚Üíclass QualityMonitor:
   970‚Üí    """Real-time <USER_ID_REDACTED> monitoring for RAG responses."""
   971‚Üí    
   972‚Üí    def __init__(self, llm_judge=None):
   973‚Üí        self.llm_judge = llm_judge
   974‚Üí        
   975‚Üí        # <USER_ID_REDACTED> assessment strategies
   976‚Üí        self.quality_assessments = {
   977‚Üí            'response_length': self._assess_response_length,
   978‚Üí            'context_utilization': self._assess_context_utilization,
   979‚Üí            'factual_consistency': self._assess_factual_consistency,
   980‚Üí            'relevance_score': self._assess_relevance,
   981‚Üí            'citation_quality': self._assess_citation_quality
   982‚Üí        }
   983‚Üí        
   984‚Üí        # <USER_ID_REDACTED> baselines (would be learned from data)
   985‚Üí        self.quality_baselines = {
   986‚Üí            'response_length': {'min': 50, 'max': 500, 'optimal': 200},
   987‚Üí            'context_utilization': {'min': 0.3, 'optimal': 0.7},
   988‚Üí            'relevance_score': {'min': 0.6, 'optimal': 0.8},
   989‚Üí            'citation_quality': {'min': 0.4, 'optimal': 0.7}
   990‚Üí        }
   991‚Üí    
   992‚Üí    def assess_quality(self, query: str, response: str, 
   993‚Üí                      contexts: List[str]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   994‚Üí        """Assess <USER_ID_REDACTED> of RAG response."""
   995‚Üí        
   996‚Üí        quality_scores = {}
   997‚Üí        quality_flags = []
   998‚Üí        
   999‚Üí        # Run all <USER_ID_REDACTED> assessments
  1000‚Üí        for assessment_name, assessment_func in self.quality_assessments.items():
  1001‚Üí            try:
  1002‚Üí                score = assessment_func(query, response, contexts)
  1003‚Üí                quality_scores[assessment_name] = score
  1004‚Üí                
  1005‚Üí                # Check against baselines
  1006‚Üí                baseline = self.quality_baselines.get(assessment_name)
  1007‚Üí                if baseline and 'min' in baseline:
  1008‚Üí                    if score < baseline['min']:
  1009‚Üí                        quality_flags.append({
  1010‚Üí                            'type': 'quality_below_threshold',
  1011‚Üí                            'assessment': assessment_name,
  1012‚Üí                            'score': score,
  1013‚Üí                            'threshold': baseline['min']
  1014‚Üí                        })
  1015‚Üí                        
  1016‚Üí            except Exception as e:
  1017‚Üí                print(f"<USER_ID_REDACTED> assessment error for {assessment_name}: {e}")
  1018‚Üí                quality_scores[assessment_name] = None
  1019‚Üí        
  1020‚Üí        # Calculate overall <USER_ID_REDACTED> score
  1021‚Üí        valid_scores = [score for score in quality_scores.values() if score is not None]
  1022‚Üí        overall_quality = np.mean(valid_scores) if valid_scores else 0.0
  1023‚Üí        
  1024‚Üí        return {
  1025‚Üí            'individual_scores': quality_scores,
  1026‚Üí            'overall_quality': overall_quality,
  1027‚Üí            'quality_flags': quality_flags,
  1028‚Üí            'assessment_timestamp': time.time()
  1029‚Üí        }
  1030‚Üí    
  1031‚Üí    def _assess_response_length(self, query: str, response: str, 
  1032‚Üí                              contexts: List[str]) -> float:
  1033‚Üí        """Assess if response length is appropriate."""
  1034‚Üí        
  1035‚Üí        response_length = len(response.split())
  1036‚Üí        baseline = self.quality_baselines['response_length']
  1037‚Üí        
  1038‚Üí        if response_length < baseline['min']:
  1039‚Üí            return response_length / baseline['min']  # Penalize too short
  1040‚Üí        elif response_length > baseline['max']:
  1041‚Üí            return baseline['max'] / response_length  # Penalize too long
  1042‚Üí        else:
  1043‚Üí            # Optimal range - score based on proximity to optimal
  1044‚Üí            distance_from_optimal = abs(response_length - baseline['optimal'])
  1045‚Üí            max_distance = max(baseline['optimal'] - baseline['min'], 
  1046‚Üí                             baseline['max'] - baseline['optimal'])
  1047‚Üí            return 1.0 - (distance_from_optimal / max_distance)
  1048‚Üí    
  1049‚Üí    def _assess_context_utilization(self, query: str, response: str,
  1050‚Üí                                  contexts: List[str]) -> float:
  1051‚Üí        """Assess how well the response utilizes provided contexts."""
  1052‚Üí        
  1053‚Üí        if not contexts:
  1054‚Üí            return 0.0
  1055‚Üí        
  1056‚Üí        # Simple word overlap assessment
  1057‚Üí        response_words = set(response.lower().split())
  1058‚Üí        
  1059‚Üí        utilization_scores = []
  1060‚Üí        for context in contexts:
  1061‚Üí            context_words = set(context.lower().split())
  1062‚Üí            overlap = len(response_words.intersection(context_words))
  1063‚Üí            context_utilization = overlap / len(context_words) if context_words else 0
  1064‚Üí            utilization_scores.append(context_utilization)
  1065‚Üí        
  1066‚Üí        # Return average utilization across all contexts
  1067‚Üí        return np.mean(utilization_scores) if utilization_scores else 0.0
  1068‚Üí```

  1074‚Üí```python
  1075‚Üí# Alerting system for RAG monitoring
  1076‚Üíclass RAGAlertingSystem:
  1077‚Üí    """Alerting system for RAG <USER_ID_REDACTED> degradation and anomalies."""
  1078‚Üí    
  1079‚Üí    def __init__(self, alert_config: Dict):
  1080‚Üí        self.alert_config = alert_config
  1081‚Üí        self.alert_history = []
  1082‚Üí        self.active_alerts = {}
  1083‚Üí        
  1084‚Üí        # Alert severity levels
  1085‚Üí        self.severity_levels = {
  1086‚Üí            'low': {'threshold_multiplier': 1.2, 'cooldown': 300},
  1087‚Üí            'medium': {'threshold_multiplier': 1.5, 'cooldown': 180}, 
  1088‚Üí            'high': {'threshold_multiplier': 2.0, 'cooldown': 60},
  1089‚Üí            'critical': {'threshold_multiplier': 3.0, 'cooldown': 0}
  1090‚Üí        }
  1091‚Üí    
  1092‚Üí    def evaluate_alert_conditions(self, monitoring_data: Dict) -> List[Dict]:
  1093‚Üí        """Evaluate if any alert conditions are met."""
  1094‚Üí        
  1095‚Üí        alerts_to_trigger = []
  1096‚Üí        current_time = time.time()
  1097‚Üí        
  1098‚Üí        # Check <USER_ID_REDACTED> degradation alerts
  1099‚Üí        quality_alerts = self._check_quality_alerts(monitoring_data)
  1100‚Üí        alerts_to_trigger.extend(quality_alerts)
  1101‚Üí        
  1102‚Üí        # Check performance alerts
  1103‚Üí        performance_alerts = self._check_performance_alerts(monitoring_data)
  1104‚Üí        alerts_to_trigger.extend(performance_alerts)
  1105‚Üí        
  1106‚Üí        # Check anomaly alerts
  1107‚Üí        anomaly_alerts = self._check_anomaly_alerts(monitoring_data)
  1108‚Üí        alerts_to_trigger.extend(anomaly_alerts)
  1109‚Üí        
  1110‚Üí        # Filter out alerts in cooldown
  1111‚Üí        filtered_alerts = []
  1112‚Üí        for alert in alerts_to_trigger:
  1113‚Üí            alert_key = f"{alert['type']}_{alert['metric']}"
  1114‚Üí

    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí## **Part 1: Understanding Document Structure Challenges (20 minutes)**
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí### **The Problem with Naive Chunking**
    47‚Üí
    48‚ÜíFrom our PDF analysis, we learned that naive RAG systems often struggle with:
    49‚Üí- **Fragmented Content**: Important information split across chunks
    50‚Üí- **Loss of Context**: Document structure ignored during chunking
    51‚Üí- **Redundant Information**: Similar content repeated across chunks
    52‚Üí- **Metadata Loss**: Structural information discarded
    53‚Üí
    54‚ÜíLet's examine these issues and build solutions:
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí### **Document Structure Analysis Framework**
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí**Step 1: Define Content Types and Data Structures**
    59‚Üí```python
    60‚Üí# src/advanced_chunking/document_analyzer.py - Core definitions
    61‚Üífrom typing import List, Dict, Any, Optional, Tuple
    62‚Üífrom dataclasses import dataclass
    63‚Üífrom langchain.schema import Document
    64‚Üíimport re
    65‚Üífrom enum import Enum
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üíclass ContentType(Enum):
    68‚Üí    HEADING = "heading"
    69‚Üí    PARAGRAPH = "paragraph"
    70‚Üí    LIST = "list"
    71‚Üí    TABLE = "table"
    72‚Üí    CODE = "code"
    73‚Üí    QUOTE = "quote"
    74‚Üí    UNKNOWN = "unknown"
    75‚Üí```
    76‚Üí
    77‚Üí*Defines content types that our analyzer can recognize, enabling intelligent processing of different document elements.*
    78‚Üí
    79‚Üí**Step 2: Document Element Structure**
    80‚Üí```python
    81‚Üí@dataclass
    82‚Üíclass DocumentElement:
    83‚Üí    """Represents a structured document element."""
    84‚Üí    content: str
    85‚Üí    element_type: ContentType
    86‚Üí    level: int  # Hierarchy level (0=top, 1=section, 2=subsection, etc.)
    87‚Üí    metadata: Dict[str, Any]
    88‚Üí    position: int  # Position in document
    89‚Üí```
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí*Structured representation of document elements with hierarchy and metadata tracking for intelligent processing.*
    92‚Üí
    93‚Üí**Step 3: Initialize Structure Analyzer**
    94‚Üí```python
    95‚Üíclass DocumentStructureAnalyzer:
    96‚Üí    """Analyzes document structure and content types."""
    97‚Üí    
    98‚Üí    def __init__(self):
    99‚Üí        self.heading_patterns = [
   100‚Üí            r'^#{1,6}\s+(.+)$',  # Markdown headers
   101‚Üí            r'^([A-Z][^a-z]*)\s*$',  # ALL CAPS headers
   102‚Üí            r'^\d+\.\s+(.+)$',  # Numbered headers
   103‚Üí            r'^[A-Z][^.!?]*:$',  # Title followed by colon
   104‚Üí        ]
   105‚Üí```
   106‚Üí
   107‚Üí*Sets up pattern recognition for different heading styles commonly found in technical documents.*
   108‚Üí
   109‚Üí**Step 1: Content Type Detection**
   110‚Üí```python
   111‚Üí    def detect_content_type(self, text: str) -> ContentType:
   112‚Üí        """Detect the type of content based on patterns."""
   113‚Üí        text = text.strip()
   114‚Üí        
   115‚Üí        if not text:
   116‚Üí            return ContentType.UNKNOWN
   117‚Üí        
   118‚Üí        # Check for headings
   119‚Üí        for pattern in self.heading_patterns:
   120‚Üí            if re.match(pattern, text, re.MULTILINE):
   121‚Üí                return ContentType.HEADING
   122‚Üí        
   123‚Üí        # Check for lists
   124‚Üí        if re.match(r'^\s*[-*+‚Ä¢]\s+', text) or re.match(r'^\s*\d+\.\s+', text):
   125‚Üí            return ContentType.LIST
   126‚Üí        
   127‚Üí        # Check for code blocks
   128‚Üí        if text.startswith('```') or text.startswith('    ') or text.startswith('\t'):
   129‚Üí            return ContentType.CODE
   130‚Üí        
   131‚Üí        # Check for quotes
   132‚Üí        if text.startswith('>') or text.startswith('"'):
   133‚Üí            return ContentType.QUOTE
   134‚Üí        
   135‚Üí        # Check for tables (simple detection)
   136‚Üí        if '|' in text and text.count('|') >= 2:
   137‚Üí            return ContentType.TABLE
   138‚Üí        
   139‚Üí        return ContentType.PARAGRAPH
   140‚Üí```
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí**Step 2: Structure Analysis Pipeline**
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí### **Main Analysis Method**
   145‚Üí```python
   146‚Üí    def analyze_structure(self, document: Document) -> List[DocumentElement]:
   147‚Üí        """Analyze document structure and create structured elements."""
   148‚Üí        content = document.page_content
   149‚Üí        lines = content.split('\n')
   150‚Üí        
   151‚Üí        elements = []
   152‚Üí        current_level = 0
   153‚Üí        position = 0
   154‚Üí```
   155‚Üí
   156‚Üí*Initializes the analysis process by breaking the document into lines and setting up tracking variables.*
   157‚Üí
   158‚Üí### **Line-by-Line Processing**
   159‚Üí```python
   160‚Üí        i = 0
   161‚Üí        while i < len(lines):
   162‚Üí            line = lines[i].strip()
   163‚Üí            
   164‚Üí            if not line:
   165‚Üí                i += 1
   166‚Üí                continue
   167‚Üí            
   168‚Üí            content_type = self.detect_content_type(line)
   169‚Üí            
   170‚Üí            # Determine hierarchy level
   171‚Üí            level = self._determine_level(line, current_level, content_type)
   172‚Üí            
   173‚Üí            # Group related lines for complex content types
   174‚Üí            element_content, lines_consumed = self._group_content_lines(
   175‚Üí                lines, i, content_type
   176‚Üí            )
   177‚Üí```
   178‚Üí
   179‚Üí*Processes each line to detect content type, determine hierarchy level, and group related lines together.*
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üí### **Element Creation and Metadata**
   182‚Üí```python
   183‚Üí            # Create document element
   184‚Üí            element = DocumentElement(
   185‚Üí                content=element_content,
   186‚Üí                element_type=content_type,
   187‚Üí                level=level,
   188‚Üí                metadata={
   189‚Üí                    "original_position": position,
   190‚Üí                    "line_number": i + 1,
   191‚Üí                    "parent_document": document.metadata.get("source", ""),
   192‚Üí                    "char_count": len(element_content),
   193‚Üí                    "word_count": len(element_content.split())
   194‚Üí                },
   195‚Üí                position=position
   196‚Üí            )
   197‚Üí            
   198‚Üí            elements.append(element)
   199‚Üí            
   200‚Üí            i += lines_consumed
   201‚Üí            position += 1
   202‚Üí            current_level = level
   203‚Üí        
   204‚Üí        return elements
   205‚Üí```
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí*Creates structured elements with rich metadata tracking position, size, and hierarchy information for intelligent chunking.*
   208‚Üí    
   209‚Üí    def _determine_level(self, line: str, current_level: int, content_type: ContentType) -> int:
   210‚Üí        """Determine hierarchy level of content."""
   211‚Üí        if content_type == ContentType.HEADING:
   212‚Üí            # Count markdown header level
   213‚Üí            if line.startswith('#'):
   214‚Üí                return line.count('#') - 1
   215‚Üí            # Or determine based on formatting
   216‚Üí            elif line.isupper():
   217‚Üí                return 0  # Top level
   218‚Üí            elif line.endswith(':'):
   219‚Üí                return current_level + 1
   220‚Üí        
   221‚Üí        return current_level + 1
   222‚Üí    
   223‚Üí    def _group_content_lines(self, lines: List[str], start_idx: int, 
   224‚Üí                           content_type: ContentType) -> Tuple[str, int]:
   225‚Üí        """Group related lines for complex content types."""
   226‚Üí        if content_type == ContentType.TABLE:
   227‚Üí            return self._group_table_lines(lines, start_idx)
   228‚Üí        elif content_type == ContentType.CODE:
   229‚Üí            return self._group_code_lines(lines, start_idx)
   230‚Üí        elif content_type == ContentType.LIST:
   231‚Üí            return self._group_list_lines(lines, start_idx)
   232‚Üí        else:
   233‚Üí            return lines[start_idx], 1
   234‚Üí```
   235‚Üí

   237‚Üí
   238‚Üí## **Part 2: Hierarchical Chunking Strategies (25 minutes)**
   239‚Üí
   240‚Üí### **Building Intelligent Chunking**
   241‚Üí
   242‚ÜíBased on our document analysis, let's implement hierarchical chunking that respects document structure:
   243‚Üí
   244‚Üí### **Hierarchical Chunking Implementation**
   245‚Üí
   246‚Üí**Step 1: Initialize Hierarchical Chunker**
   247‚Üí```python
   248‚Üí# src/advanced_chunking/hierarchical_chunker.py - Setup
   249‚Üífrom typing import List, Dict, Any, Optional
   250‚Üífrom langchain.schema import Document
   251‚Üífrom .document_analyzer import DocumentStructureAnalyzer, DocumentElement, ContentType
   252‚Üí
   253‚Üíclass HierarchicalChunker:
   254‚Üí    """Creates intelligent chunks based on document hierarchy."""
   255‚Üí    
   256‚Üí    def __init__(self, 
   257‚Üí                 max_chunk_size: int = 1000,
   258‚Üí                 min_chunk_size: int = 100,
   259‚Üí                 overlap_ratio: float = 0.1):
   260‚Üí        self.max_chunk_size = max_chunk_size
   261‚Üí        self.min_chunk_size = min_chunk_size
   262‚Üí        self.overlap_ratio = overlap_ratio
   263‚Üí        self.analyzer = DocumentStructureAnalyzer()
   264‚Üí```
   265‚Üí
   266‚Üí*Configures the hierarchical chunker with size constraints and overlap settings for optimal context preservation.*
   267‚Üí
   268‚Üí**Step 3: Structure-Aware Chunking**
   269‚Üí```python
   270‚Üí    def create_hierarchical_chunks(self, document: Document) -> List[Document]:
   271‚Üí        """Create chunks that preserve document hierarchy."""
   272‚Üí        # Analyze document structure
   273‚Üí        elements = self.analyzer.analyze_structure(document)
   274‚Üí        
   275‚Üí        # Group elements into logical sections
   276‚Üí        sections = self._group_elements_by_hierarchy(elements)
   277‚Üí        
   278‚Üí        # Create chunks from sections
   279‚Üí        chunks = []
   280‚Üí        for section in sections:
   281‚Üí            section_chunks = self._chunk_section(section, document.metadata)
   282‚Üí            chunks.extend(section_chunks)
   283‚Üí        
   284‚Üí        return chunks
   285‚Üí    
   286‚Üí    def _group_elements_by_hierarchy(self, elements: List[DocumentElement]) -> List[List[DocumentElement]]:
   287‚Üí        """Group elements into hierarchical sections."""
   288‚Üí        sections = []
   289‚Üí        current_section = []
   290‚Üí        current_level = -1
   291‚Üí        
   292‚Üí        for element in elements:
   293‚Üí            # Start new section on same or higher level heading
   294‚Üí            if (element.element_type == ContentType.HEADING and 
   295‚Üí                element.level <= current_level and current_section):
   296‚Üí                sections.append(current_section)
   297‚Üí                current_section = [element]
   298‚Üí                current_level = element.level
   299‚Üí            elif element.element_type == ContentType.HEADING and not current_section:
   300‚Üí                current_section = [element]
   301‚Üí                current_level = element.level
   302‚Üí            else:
   303‚Üí                current_section.append(element)
   304‚Üí        
   305‚Üí        # Add final section
   306‚Üí        if current_section:
   307‚Üí            sections.append(current_section)
   308‚Üí        
   309‚Üí        return sections
   310‚Üí```
   311‚Üí
   312‚Üí**Step 4: Semantic Chunk Creation**
   313‚Üí
   314‚Üí### **Section Chunking Strategy**
   315‚Üí```python
   316‚Üí    def _chunk_section(self, section: List[DocumentElement], 
   317‚Üí                      base_metadata: Dict) -> List[Document]:
   318‚Üí        """Create chunks from a document section."""
   319‚Üí        chunks = []
   320‚Üí        current_chunk_elements = []
   321‚Üí        current_size = 0
   322‚Üí        
   323‚Üí        section_title = self._extract_section_title(section)
   324‚Üí```
   325‚Üí
   326‚Üí*Initializes section chunking with title extraction for better context understanding.*
   327‚Üí
   328‚Üí### **Element Processing Loop**
   329‚Üí```python
   330‚Üí        for element in section:
   331‚Üí            element_size = len(element.content)
   332‚Üí            
   333‚Üí            # If adding this element would exceed chunk size
   334‚Üí            if current_size + element_size > self.max_chunk_size and current_chunk_elements:
   335‚Üí                # Create chunk from current elements
   336‚Üí                chunk = self._create_chunk_from_elements(
   337‚Üí                    current_chunk_elements, 
   338‚Üí                    base_metadata, 
   339‚Üí                    section_title
   340‚Üí                )
   341‚Üí                chunks.append(chunk)
   342‚Üí                
   343‚Üí                # Start new chunk with overlap
   344‚Üí                overlap_elements = self._get_overlap_elements(current_chunk_elements)
   345‚Üí                current_chunk_elements = overlap_elements + [element]
   346‚Üí                current_size = sum(len(e.content) for e in current_chunk_elements)
   347‚Üí            else:
   348‚Üí                current_chunk_elements.append(element)
   349‚Üí                current_size += element_size
   350‚Üí```
   351‚Üí
   352‚Üí*Intelligently builds chunks by monitoring size and creating overlap between chunks for context continuity.*
   353‚Üí
   354‚Üí### **Final Chunk Creation**
   355‚Üí```python
   356‚Üí        # Create final chunk
   357‚Üí        if current_chunk_elements:
   358‚Üí            chunk = self._create_chunk_from_elements(
   359‚Üí                current_chunk_elements, 
   360‚Üí                base_metadata, 
   361‚Üí                section_title
   362‚Üí            )
   363‚Üí            chunks.append(chunk)
   364‚Üí        
   365‚Üí        return chunks
   366‚Üí```
   367‚Üí
   368‚Üí*Ensures no content is lost by processing the final set of elements into a complete chunk.*
   369‚Üí
   370‚Üí**Step 5: Rich Metadata Preservation**
   371‚Üí```python
   372‚Üí    def _create_chunk_from_elements(self, elements: List[DocumentElement], 
   373‚Üí                                  base_metadata: Dict, section_title: str) -> Document:
   374‚Üí        """Create a document chunk with rich metadata."""
   375‚Üí        # Combine element content
   376‚Üí        content_parts = []
   377‚Üí        for element in elements:
   378‚Üí            if element.element_type == ContentType.HEADING:
   379‚Üí                content_parts.append(f"\n{element.content}\n")
   380‚Üí            else:
   381‚Üí                content_parts.append(element.content)
   382‚Üí        
   383‚Üí        content = "\n".join(content_parts).strip()
   384‚Üí        
   385‚Üí        # Extract rich metadata
   386‚Üí        content_types = [e.element_type.value for e in elements]
   387‚Üí        hierarchy_levels = [e.level for e in elements]
   388‚Üí        
   389‚Üí        enhanced_metadata = {
   390‚Üí            **base_metadata,
   391‚Üí            "section_title": section_title,
   392‚Üí            "chunk_type": "hierarchical",
   393‚Üí            "content_types": list(set(content_types)),
   394‚Üí            "hierarchy_levels": hierarchy_levels,
   395‚Üí            "element_count": len(elements),
   396‚Üí            "has_heading": ContentType.HEADING.value in content_types,
   397‚Üí            "has_table": ContentType.TABLE.value in content_types,
   398‚Üí            "has_code": ContentType.CODE.value in content_types,
   399‚Üí            "min_hierarchy_level": min(hierarchy_levels),
   400‚Üí            "max_hierarchy_level": max(hierarchy_levels)
   401‚Üí        }
   402‚Üí        
   403‚Üí        return Document(page_content=content, metadata=enhanced_metadata)
   404‚Üí    
   405‚Üí    def _extract_section_title(self, section: List[DocumentElement]) -> str:
   406‚Üí        """Extract title from section elements."""
   407‚Üí        for element in section:
   408‚Üí            if element.element_type == ContentType.HEADING:
   409‚Üí                return element.content.strip('#').strip()
   410‚Üí        return "Untitled Section"
   411‚Üí    
   412‚Üí    def _get_overlap_elements(self, elements: List[DocumentElement]) -> List[DocumentElement]:
   413‚Üí        """Get elements for overlap between chunks."""
   414‚Üí        if not elements:
   415‚Üí            return []
   416‚Üí        
   417‚Üí        total_chars = sum(len(e.content) for e in elements)
   418‚Üí        overlap_chars = int(total_chars * self.overlap_ratio)
   419‚Üí        
   420‚Üí        overlap_elements = []
   421‚Üí        current_chars = 0
   422‚Üí        
   423‚Üí        # Take elements from the end for overlap
   424‚Üí        for element in reversed(elements):
   425‚Üí            overlap_elements.insert(0, element)
   426‚Üí            current_chars += len(element.content)
   427‚Üí            if current_chars >= overlap_chars:
   428‚Üí                break
   429‚Üí        
   430‚Üí        return overlap_elements
   431‚Üí```
   432‚Üí
   433‚Üí### **Advanced Chunking Strategies**
   434‚Üí
   435‚ÜíLet's implement specialized chunkers for different content types:
   436‚Üí
   437‚Üí```python
   438‚Üí# src/advanced_chunking/specialized_chunkers.py
   439‚Üífrom typing import List, Dict, Any
   440‚Üífrom langchain.schema import Document
   441‚Üíimport pandas as pd
   442‚Üífrom io import StringIO
   443‚Üí
   444‚Üíclass TableAwareChunker:
   445‚Üí    """Specialized chunker that preserves table structure."""
   446‚Üí    
   447‚Üí    def __init__(self, max_chunk_size: int = 1500):
   448‚Üí        self.max_chunk_size = max_chunk_size
   449‚Üí    
   450‚Üí    def chunk_with_tables(self, document: Document) -> List[Document]:
   451‚Üí        """Chunk document while preserving table integrity."""
   452‚Üí        content = document.page_content
   453‚Üí        
   454‚Üí        # Identify table sections
   455‚Üí        table_sections = self._identify_tables(content)
   456‚Üí        
   457‚Üí        chunks = []
   458‚Üí        current_pos = 0
   459‚Üí        
   460‚Üí        for table_start, table_end in table_sections:
   461‚Üí            # Add content before table
   462‚Üí            if current_pos < table_start:
   463‚Üí                pre_table_content = content[current_pos:table_start].strip()
   464‚Üí                if pre_table_content:
   465‚Üí                    pre_chunks = self._chunk_text(pre_table_content, document.metadata)
   466‚Üí                    chunks.extend(pre_chunks)
   467‚Üí            
   468‚Üí            # Add table as separate chunk
   469‚Üí            table_content = content[table_start:table_end]
   470‚Üí            table_chunk = self._create_table_chunk(table_content, document.metadata)
   471‚Üí            chunks.append(table_chunk)
   472‚Üí            
   473‚Üí            current_pos = table_end
   474‚Üí        
   475‚Üí        # Add remaining content
   476‚Üí        if current_pos < len(content):
   477‚Üí            remaining_content = content[current_pos:].strip()
   478‚Üí            if remaining_content:
   479‚Üí                remaining_chunks = self._chunk_text(remaining_content, document.metadata)
   480‚Üí                chunks.extend(remaining_chunks)
   481‚Üí        
   482‚Üí        return chunks
   483‚Üí```
   484‚Üí
   485‚Üí**Step 6: Table Processing**
   486‚Üí```python
   487‚Üí    def _create_table_chunk(self, table_content: str, base_metadata: Dict) -> Document:
   488‚Üí        """Create a specialized chunk for table content."""
   489‚Üí        # Parse table structure
   490‚Üí        table_info = self._analyze_table_structure(table_content)
   491‚Üí        
   492‚Üí        enhanced_metadata = {
   493‚Üí            **base_metadata,
   494‚Üí            "content_type": "table",
   495‚Üí            "table_rows": table_info["rows"],
   496‚Üí            "table_columns": table_info["columns"],
   497‚Üí            "table_headers": table_info["headers"],
   498‚Üí            "is_structured_data": True
   499‚Üí        }
   500‚Üí        
   501‚Üí        # Enhance table content with description
   502‚Üí        enhanced_content = self._enhance_table_content(table_content, table_info)
   503‚Üí        
   504‚Üí        return Document(page_content=enhanced_content, metadata=enhanced_metadata)
   505‚Üí    
   506‚Üí    def _analyze_table_structure(self, table_content: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   507‚Üí        """Analyze table structure and extract metadata."""
   508‚Üí        lines = table_content.strip().split('\n')
   509‚Üí        table_lines = [line for line in lines if '|' in line]
   510‚Üí        
   511‚Üí        if not table_lines:
   512‚Üí            return {"rows": 0, "columns": 0, "headers": []}
   513‚Üí        
   514‚Üí        # Extract headers from first row
   515‚Üí        headers = []
   516‚Üí        if table_lines:
   517‚Üí            header_row = table_lines[0]
   518‚Üí            headers = [cell.strip() for cell in header_row.split('|') if cell.strip()]
   519‚Üí        
   520‚Üí        return {
   521‚Üí            "rows": len(table_lines),
   522‚Üí            "columns": len(headers),
   523‚Üí            "headers": headers
   524‚Üí        }
   525‚Üí    
   526‚Üí    def _enhance_table_content(self, table_content: str, table_info: Dict) -> str:
   527‚Üí        """Add descriptive text to table content."""
   528‚Üí        description = f"Table with {table_info['rows']} rows and {table_info['columns']} columns"
   529‚Üí        
   530‚Üí        if table_info['headers']:
   531‚Üí            headers_text = ", ".join(table_info['headers'])
   532‚Üí            description += f" containing data about: {headers_text}"
   533‚Üí        
   534‚Üí        return f"{description}\n\n{table_content}"
   535‚Üí```

   539‚Üí## **Part 3: Metadata Extraction and Enrichment (25 minutes)**
   540‚Üí
   541‚Üí### **Intelligent Metadata Extraction**
   542‚Üí
   543‚ÜíRich metadata significantly improves retrieval <USER_ID_REDACTED>. Let's build an advanced metadata extraction system:
   544‚Üí
   545‚Üí```python
   546‚Üí# src/advanced_chunking/metadata_extractor.py
   547‚Üífrom typing import List, Dict, Any, Optional, Set
   548‚Üífrom langchain.schema import Document
   549‚Üíimport re
   550‚Üífrom datetime import datetime
   551‚Üífrom dataclasses import dataclass
   552‚Üí
   553‚Üí@dataclass
   554‚Üíclass ExtractedMetadata:
   555‚Üí    """Container for extracted metadata."""
   556‚Üí    entities: List[str]
   557‚Üí    keywords: List[str]
   558‚Üí    topics: List[str]
   559‚Üí    dates: List[str]
   560‚Üí    numbers: List[float]
   561‚Üí    technical_terms: List[str]
   562‚Üí    difficulty_level: str
   563‚Üí    content_summary: str
   564‚Üí
   565‚Üíclass MetadataExtractor:
   566‚Üí    """Extracts rich metadata from document content."""
   567‚Üí    
   568‚Üí    def __init__(self):
   569‚Üí        self.technical_patterns = [
   570‚Üí            r'\b[A-Z]{2,}\b',  # Acronyms
   571‚Üí            r'\b\w+\(\)\b',    # Function calls
   572‚Üí            r'\b[a-zA-Z_]\w*\.[a-zA-Z_]\w*\b',  # Object notation
   573‚Üí            r'\b\d+\.\d+\.\d+\b',  # Version numbers
   574‚Üí        ]
   575‚Üí        
   576‚Üí        self.date_patterns = [
   577‚Üí            r'\b\d{1,2}[/-]\d{1,2}[/-]\d{4}\b',
   578‚Üí            r'\b\d{4}[-/]\d{1,2}[-/]\d{1,2}\b',
   579‚Üí            r'\b(?:Jan|Feb|Mar|Apr|May|Jun|Jul|Aug|Sep|Oct|Nov|Dec)[a-z]*\s+\d{1,2},?\s+\d{4}\b'
   580‚Üí        ]
   581‚Üí```
   582‚Üí
   583‚Üí**Step 7: Entity and Keyword Extraction**
   584‚Üí```python
   585‚Üí    def extract_enhanced_metadata(self, document: Document) -> ExtractedMetadata:
   586‚Üí        """Extract comprehensive metadata from document."""
   587‚Üí        content = document.page_content
   588‚Üí        
   589‚Üí        # Extract different types of information
   590‚Üí        entities = self._extract_entities(content)
   591‚Üí        keywords = self._extract_keywords(content)
   592‚Üí        topics = self._infer_topics(content)
   593‚Üí        dates = self._extract_dates(content)
   594‚Üí        numbers = self._extract_numbers(content)
   595‚Üí        technical_terms = self._extract_technical_terms(content)
   596‚Üí        difficulty_level = self._assess_difficulty(content)
   597‚Üí        content_summary = self._generate_summary(content)
   598‚Üí        
   599‚Üí        return ExtractedMetadata(
   600‚Üí            entities=entities,
   601‚Üí            keywords=keywords,
   602‚Üí            topics=topics,
   603‚Üí            dates=dates,
   604‚Üí            numbers=numbers,
   605‚Üí            technical_terms=technical_terms,
   606‚Üí            difficulty_level=difficulty_level,
   607‚Üí            content_summary=content_summary
   608‚Üí        )
   609‚Üí    
   610‚Üí    def _extract_entities(self, content: str) -> List[str]:
   611‚Üí        """Extract named entities using pattern matching."""
   612‚Üí        entities = []
   613‚Üí        
   614‚Üí        # Extract capitalized words (potential proper nouns)
   615‚Üí        capitalized_words = re.findall(r'\b[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*\b', content)
   616‚Üí        entities.extend(capitalized_words)
   617‚Üí        
   618‚Üí        # Extract quoted terms
   619‚Üí        quoted_terms = re.findall(r'"([^"]*)"', content)
   620‚Üí        entities.extend(quoted_terms)
   621‚Üí        
   622‚Üí        # Remove duplicates and filter by length
   623‚Üí        entities = list(set([e for e in entities if len(e) > 2 and len(e) < 50]))
   624‚Üí        
   625‚Üí        return entities[:10]  # Limit to top 10
   626‚Üí```
   627‚Üí
   628‚Üí**Step 8: Topic and Difficulty Assessment**
   629‚Üí```python
   630‚Üí    def _infer_topics(self, content: str) -> List[str]:
   631‚Üí        """Infer topics from content using keyword analysis."""
   632‚Üí        # Define topic keywords
   633‚Üí        topic_keywords = {
   634‚Üí            "technology": ["software", "computer", "digital", "algorithm", "data", "system"],
   635‚Üí            "science": ["research", "study", "analysis", "experiment", "hypothesis", "theory"],
   636‚Üí            "business": ["market", "customer", "revenue", "strategy", "company", "industry"],
   637‚Üí            "education": ["learning", "student", "teach", "course", "curriculum", "knowledge"],
   638‚Üí            "health": ["medical", "health", "patient", "treatment", "diagnosis", "therapy"]
   639‚Üí        }
   640‚Üí        
   641‚Üí        content_lower = content.lower()
   642‚Üí        topic_scores = {}
   643‚Üí        
   644‚Üí        for topic, keywords in topic_keywords.items():
   645‚Üí            score = sum(content_lower.count(keyword) for keyword in keywords)
   646‚Üí            if score > 0:
   647‚Üí                topic_scores[topic] = score
   648‚Üí        
   649‚Üí        # Return topics sorted by relevance
   650‚Üí        return sorted(topic_scores.keys(), key=lambda x: topic_scores[x], reverse=True)[:3]
   651‚Üí    
   652‚Üí    def _assess_difficulty(self, content: str) -> str:
   653‚Üí        """Assess content difficulty level."""
   654‚Üí        words = content.split()
   655‚Üí        sentences = content.split('.')
   656‚Üí        
   657‚Üí        if not words or not sentences:
   658‚Üí            return "unknown"
   659‚Üí        
   660‚Üí        # Calculate readability metrics
   661‚Üí        avg_words_per_sentence = len(words) / len(sentences)
   662‚Üí        long_words = len([w for w in words if len(w) > 6])
   663‚Üí        long_word_ratio = long_words / len(words)
   664‚Üí        
   665‚Üí        # Technical term density
   666‚Üí        technical_terms = len(self._extract_technical_terms(content))
   667‚Üí        technical_density = technical_terms / len(words) if words else 0
   668‚Üí        
   669‚Üí        # Determine difficulty
   670‚Üí        if avg_words_per_sentence > 20 or long_word_ratio > 0.3 or technical_density > 0.1:
   671‚Üí            return "advanced"
   672‚Üí        elif avg_words_per_sentence > 15 or long_word_ratio > 0.2:
   673‚Üí            return "intermediate"
   674‚Üí        else:
   675‚Üí            return "beginner"
   676‚Üí    
   677‚Üí    def _generate_summary(self, content: str) -> str:
   678‚Üí        """Generate a brief summary of the content."""
   679‚Üí        sentences = content.split('.')
   680‚Üí        if len(sentences) <= 2:
   681‚Üí            return content[:200] + "..." if len(content) > 200 else content
   682‚Üí        
   683‚Üí        # Take first and potentially last sentence for summary
   684‚Üí        first_sentence = sentences[0].strip()
   685‚Üí        
   686‚Üí        if len(sentences) > 3:
   687‚Üí            # Find sentence with important keywords
   688‚Üí            important_sentence = self._find_important_sentence(sentences[1:-1])
   689‚Üí            summary = f"{first_sentence}. {important_sentence}"
   690‚Üí        else:
   691‚Üí            summary = first_sentence
   692‚Üí        
   693‚Üí        return summary[:300] + "..." if len(summary) > 300 else summary
   694‚Üí```
   695‚Üí
   696‚Üí### **Metadata-Enhanced Chunking**
   697‚Üí
   698‚ÜíNow let's integrate metadata extraction into our chunking process:
   699‚Üí
   700‚Üí```python
   701‚Üí# src/advanced_chunking/metadata_enhanced_chunker.py
   702‚Üífrom typing import List, Dict, Any
   703‚Üífrom langchain.schema import Document
   704‚Üífrom .metadata_extractor import MetadataExtractor
   705‚Üífrom .hierarchical_chunker import HierarchicalChunker
   706‚Üí
   707‚Üíclass MetadataEnhancedChunker:
   708‚Üí    """Chunker that enriches chunks with extracted metadata."""
   709‚Üí    
   710‚Üí    def __init__(self, max_chunk_size: int = 1000):
   711‚Üí        self.hierarchical_chunker = HierarchicalChunker(max_chunk_size=max_chunk_size)
   712‚Üí        self.metadata_extractor = MetadataExtractor()
   713‚Üí    
   714‚Üí    def create_enhanced_chunks(self, document: Document) -> List[Document]:
   715‚Üí        """Create chunks with rich metadata."""
   716‚Üí        # First, create hierarchical chunks
   717‚Üí        chunks = self.hierarchical_chunker.create_hierarchical_chunks(document)
   718‚Üí        
   719‚Üí        # Enhance each chunk with extracted metadata
   720‚Üí        enhanced_chunks = []
   721‚Üí        for chunk in chunks:
   722‚Üí            enhanced_chunk = self._enhance_chunk_metadata(chunk)
   723‚Üí            enhanced_chunks.append(enhanced_chunk)
   724‚Üí        
   725‚Üí        return enhanced_chunks
   726‚Üí```
   727‚Üí
   728‚Üí**Step 9: Chunk Enhancement**
   729‚Üí```python
   730‚Üí    def _enhance_chunk_metadata(self, chunk: Document) -> Document:
   731‚Üí        """Enhance chunk with extracted metadata."""
   732‚Üí        # Extract metadata from chunk content
   733‚Üí        extracted_metadata = self.metadata_extractor.extract_enhanced_metadata(chunk)
   734‚Üí        
   735‚Üí        # Merge with existing metadata
   736‚Üí        enhanced_metadata = {
   737‚Üí            **chunk.metadata,
   738‚Üí            "entities": extracted_metadata.entities,
   739‚Üí            "keywords": extracted_metadata.keywords,
   740‚Üí            "topics": extracted_metadata.topics,
   741‚Üí            "dates": extracted_metadata.dates,
   742‚Üí            "technical_terms": extracted_metadata.technical_terms,
   743‚Üí            "difficulty_level": extracted_metadata.difficulty_level,
   744‚Üí            "content_summary": extracted_metadata.content_summary,
   745‚Üí            "word_count": len(chunk.page_content.split()),
   746‚Üí            "char_count": len(chunk.page_content),
   747‚Üí            "enhanced_at": datetime.now().isoformat()
   748‚Üí        }
   749‚Üí        
   750‚Üí        # Create searchable content that includes metadata
   751‚Üí        searchable_content = self._create_searchable_content(chunk.page_content, extracted_metadata)
   752‚Üí        
   753‚Üí        return Document(
   754‚Üí            page_content=searchable_content,
   755‚Üí            metadata=enhanced_metadata
   756‚Üí        )
   757‚Üí    
   758‚Üí    def _create_searchable_content(self, original_content: str, metadata: Any) -> str:
   759‚Üí        """Create enhanced searchable content."""
   760‚Üí        # Add metadata as searchable text
   761‚Üí        metadata_text_parts = []
   762‚Üí        
   763‚Üí        if metadata.keywords:
   764‚Üí            metadata_text_parts.append(f"Keywords: {', '.join(metadata.keywords)}")
   765‚Üí        
   766‚Üí        if metadata.topics:
   767‚Üí            metadata_text_parts.append(f"Topics: {', '.join(metadata.topics)}")
   768‚Üí        
   769‚Üí        if metadata.entities:
   770‚Üí            metadata_text_parts.append(f"Entities: {', '.join(metadata.entities[:5])}")
   771‚Üí        
   772‚Üí        if metadata.content_summary:
   773‚Üí            metadata_text_parts.append(f"Summary: {metadata.content_summary}")
   774‚Üí        
   775‚Üí        metadata_text = "\n".join(metadata_text_parts)
   776‚Üí        
   777‚Üí        # Combine original content with metadata
   778‚Üí        if metadata_text:
   779‚Üí            return f"{original_content}\n\n--- Metadata ---\n{metadata_text}"
   780‚Üí        else:
   781‚Üí            return original_content
   782‚Üí```

   786‚Üí## **Part 4: Multi-Modal Content Processing (20 minutes)**
   787‚Üí
   788‚Üí### **Handling Complex Document Types**
   789‚Üí
   790‚ÜíReal-world documents often contain images, tables, and mixed content. Let's build processors for these:
   791‚Üí
   792‚Üí```python
   793‚Üí# src/advanced_chunking/multimodal_processor.py
   794‚Üífrom typing import List, Dict, Any, Optional, Union
   795‚Üífrom langchain.schema import Document
   796‚Üíimport base64
   797‚Üífrom PIL import Image
   798‚Üífrom io import BytesIO
   799‚Üíimport pandas as pd
   800‚Üí
   801‚Üíclass MultiModalProcessor:
   802‚Üí    """Process documents with mixed content types."""
   803‚Üí    
   804‚Üí    def __init__(self):
   805‚Üí        self.supported_image_formats = ['.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png', '.gif', '.bmp']
   806‚Üí        self.supported_table_formats = ['.csv', '.xlsx', '.xls']
   807‚Üí    
   808‚Üí    def process_document_with_images(self, document: Document, 
   809‚Üí                                   image_descriptions: Dict[str, str] = None) -> Document:
   810‚Üí        """Process document that may contain image references."""
   811‚Üí        content = document.page_content
   812‚Üí        
   813‚Üí        # Find image references
   814‚Üí        image_refs = self._find_image_references(content)
   815‚Üí        
   816‚Üí        # Replace image references with descriptions
   817‚Üí        enhanced_content = content
   818‚Üí        for img_ref in image_refs:
   819‚Üí            description = self._get_image_description(img_ref, image_descriptions)
   820‚Üí            enhanced_content = enhanced_content.replace(
   821‚Üí                img_ref, 
   822‚Üí                f"[IMAGE: {description}]"
   823‚Üí            )
   824‚Üí        
   825‚Üí        enhanced_metadata = {
   826‚Üí            **document.metadata,
   827‚Üí            "has_images": len(image_refs) > 0,
   828‚Üí            "image_count": len(image_refs),
   829‚Üí            "image_references": image_refs
   830‚Üí        }
   831‚Üí        
   832‚Üí        return Document(page_content=enhanced_content, metadata=enhanced_metadata)
   833‚Üí```
   834‚Üí
   835‚Üí**Step 10: Structured Data Processing**
   836‚Üí```python
   837‚Üí    def process_structured_data(self, data_content: str, data_type: str) -> Document:
   838‚Üí        """Process structured data (CSV, JSON, etc.)."""
   839‚Üí        if data_type.lower() in ['csv']:
   840‚Üí            return self._process_csv_data(data_content)
   841‚Üí        elif data_type.lower() in ['json']:
   842‚Üí            return self._process_json_data(data_content)
   843‚Üí        else:
   844‚Üí            # Fallback to text processing
   845‚Üí            return Document(page_content=data_content)
   846‚Üí    
   847‚Üí    def _process_csv_data(self, csv_content: str) -> Document:
   848‚Üí        """Process CSV data into readable format."""
